column4: I'm trying to get my hacking learning on for messing with android, but I can't figure out how to add 16:27:ac:a5:76:28:2d:36:63:1b:56:4d:eb:df:a6:48 so it's not a public key, so I can pull this source I want from github?
I like the Eric IDE for python.
what's they trying to do jrib?
So how do I add an ssh-rsa key to my list of accepted keys?
I'm trying to pull github code...
but it's saying something about their key not being accepted.
you should just git clone git://github.com/etc/foobar.git
unless you're trying to use your own github account in which case you'll need to give your own ssh public key to them via the web interface
perhaps if you're not busy atm and have a second, you could explain to me a bit better how to push this, and my changes back to my own repo?
it's been a while since i used git but i think `git commit -a`
i recommend you read a git tutorial though, and maybe ask on #git
i don't really need money but if you really wanna donate, give to those that need it more than me :) http://omusa.org/give/
